edu.ithaca.iclibrary

Class MaterialCoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ithaca.iclibrary.MaterialCoder

  • public class MaterialCoder
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Joseph on 4/26/2016. Processes the Material object for the purposes of saving them to Favorites. Saves lists of Materials to a .txt file on the device's internal storage with JSON strings. Unpacks the save file and converts it to a list of Materials.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MaterialCoder(Context context)
      Constructs a new MaterialCoder with a Context to direct it to a save file location.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Material decode(JSONObject enc)
      Returns a Material made from data stored in enc.
      static java.util.List<Material> decode(java.util.List<JSONObject> listEnc)
      Returns a List of Materials made from data stored in listEnc.
      static java.util.List<JSONObject> encode(java.util.List<Material> listMat)
      Returns a list of JSONObjects containing the data of Materials in Material List listMat.
      static JSONObject encode(Material mat)
      Creates JSONObject from Material mat.
      java.lang.String getFileDirectoryPath()
      Returns the MaterialCoder's Context's save path for files, plus the folder name for the ICLibrary app and the name of the text file in which Favorites are saved (i.e.
      void remove(Material mat)
      Removes all instances of mat from the Favorites text file.
      static void saveMat(Material mat)
      Saves a JSON string of mat to the savePath.txt file in the directory of path.
      static void saveMats(java.util.List<Material> listMat)
      Writes the data of listMat to a save file in a location determined by the MaterialCoder's Context.
      static java.util.List<JSONObject> unpack(java.lang.String filePath)
      Returns a list of JSONObjects from the file at filePath.

      • saveMats

        public static void saveMats(java.util.List<Material> listMat)
        Writes the data of listMat to a save file in a location determined by the MaterialCoder's Context. Data is encoded as JSONStrings.
        Parameters:
        listMat -

      • getFileDirectoryPath

        public java.lang.String getFileDirectoryPath()
        Returns the MaterialCoder's Context's save path for files, plus the folder name for the ICLibrary app and the name of the text file in which Favorites are saved (i.e. ..../ICLibrary/Favorites.txt).
        Returns:
